title: Some ASN.1 errors are not detected on load
body:
The changelog for 35.0.0 contains a note that

> Invalid ASN.1 found during x509 parsing will raise an error on initial parse rather than when the invalid field is accessed.

However cryptography 35.0.0 and current main branch do not detect ``EncodedDefault`` DER violation on load. The test case from PR #6370 does not fail to load. It only fails after I attempt to retrieve the extension.

Output from test run https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/pull/6370/checks?check_run_id=3811765665

```
_______________ TestRSACertificateRequest.test_freeipa_bad_bool ________________
[gw0] linux -- Python 3.9.2 /__w/cryptography/cryptography/.tox/py39/bin/python

self = <tests.x509.test_x509.TestRSACertificateRequest object at 0x7f6bf54040a0>
backend = <OpenSSLBackend(version: OpenSSL 1.1.1k  25 Mar 2021, FIPS: False)>

    def test_freeipa_bad_bool(self, backend):
        csr = _load_cert(
            os.path.join("x509", "requests", "freeipa_bad_bool.pem"),
            x509.load_pem_x509_csr,
            backend,
        )
>       subject_alternative_name = csr.extensions.get_extension_for_oid(
            ExtensionOID.SUBJECT_ALTERNATIVE_NAME
        )
E       ValueError: error parsing asn1 value: ParseError { kind: EncodedDefault, location: ["0", "Extension::critical"] }

tests/x509/test_x509.py:1737: ValueError
```
